definition: To take up or start using something; to legally take another’s child into your family.
examples: The school will adopt a new reading programme.
They decided to adopt a child.

extra.memory_tip: Adopt = ‘add’ a practice or a person to your home.

definition: To cause a feeling, response, or interest; to wake someone from sleep.
examples: The speech aroused great interest.
The alarm aroused him at six o’clock.

definition: To put things in a neat order; to plan or organise something.
examples: Please arrange the books by size.
We arranged a meeting for Tuesday.

definition: The smallest unit of a living thing; a small room such as in a prison; one part of a battery that produces electricity.
examples: Human skin is made of many tiny cells.
The prisoner was kept in a cell overnight.

extra.memory_tip: Cell = a small ‘cellar’ of life or space.

definition: Illness caused when germs enter the body and begin to grow.
examples: The cut showed signs of infection.
Hand washing helps prevent infection.

extra.memory_tip: Infection = germs ‘in’ the body create trouble.

definition: The power to affect how someone thinks or acts; to affect or change someone or something.
examples: Parents have a strong influence on habits. (noun)
Good books can influence your thinking. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Influence = ‘in-flow’ of ideas that shift choices.

definition: To hurt a person or animal; to damage part of the body.
examples: He injured his ankle during the match.
Sharp tools can injure you if misused.

definition: A repeated design or regular way in which something happens; to model or decorate with a pattern.
examples: The fabric has a star pattern. (noun)
Their lessons are patterned on a weekly cycle. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Pattern = a ‘pat’ of repeats again and again.

definition: A number of events, objects, or episodes that come one after another; a set of related TV or radio programmes.
examples: We ran a series of experiments in class.
We watched the nature series on Sunday.

extra.memory_tip: Series = things ‘in a row’ over time.

definition: The ability to see; an idea or mental picture of what could be in the future.
examples: Protect your vision with safety goggles.
The team shared a clear vision for the project.

extra.memory_tip: Vision = eyes for now and ideas for later.
